name: Education Powerhouse
title: Top Female Teachers
description: In 2023, an impressive 99.5% of primary education teachers in Belarus were female, showcasing the country's commitment to gender equality in education.

name: Educated Nation
title: High Educational Attainment
description: As of 2023, 98.18% of Belarusian women aged 25 and older had completed at least upper secondary education, reflecting a strong educational foundation.

name: Maternal Health Champions
title: Lowest Maternal Mortality
description: Belarus boasts one of the lowest maternal mortality ratios globally, with only 1 death per 100,000 live births in 2023, highlighting its advanced healthcare system.

name: Carbon Guardians
title: Negative CO2 Flux from Deforestation
description: In 2022, Belarus achieved a net negative CO2 flux from deforestation, contributing to global environmental sustainability efforts.

name: Aid Deficit
title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid
description: In 2022, Belarus experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow from DAC donors and European Union institutions, amounting to -$102.24 million, indicating financial challenges.

name: Private Education Rarity
title: Minimal Private School Enrollment
description: In 2023, only 0.01% of primary school students in Belarus were enrolled in private institutions, suggesting a predominantly public education system.

name: Income Equality
title: Fair Income Distribution
description: In 2020, the lowest 10% of income earners in Belarus held 4.5% of the national income, indicating a relatively equitable income distribution.

name: Early Marriage Rarity
title: Low Child Marriage Rates
description: As of 2019, only 0.1% of Belarusian women aged 20-24 were married by age 15, reflecting progressive social norms.

name: Basic Education Gap
title: Low Male Basic Education
description: In 2023, only 17.82% of the male working-age population in Belarus had basic education, highlighting a potential area for educational improvement.
